user_review: I literally travel the world looking for good Portuguese chicken.   This rivals, if not even beats some of the ones I've found in Portugal.   This place is tasty, affordable, cheap and healthy (minus the tasty fries!).     If you're in the neighborhood, or even NEAR the neighborhood....stop by here!

When you're in Montreal, you definitely need to stop by a Portuguese chicken shop. Fortunately, there are plenty of restaurants serving fresh rotisserie chicken with freshly baked Portuguese egg tarts for you to feast on. We ordered a whole chicken, poutine, and Portuguese egg tarts. We originally planned on getting each half a chicken but decided on a whole chicken which was only $15. I found the chicken to be a bit on the dry side. The seasoning however was pretty good. You can opt for spicy or regular chicken, and I asked for the spicy. It wasn't really spicy though. I should have gotten some sauce on the side for the chicken. Poutine here is great. They load up on cheese and gravy for your fries, which is always welcome. The egg tarts were very tasty. The top is slightly crispy, and the filling is creamy and sweet. These will always be a guilty pleasure of mine. When you order here, you simply tell the kitchen what you would like and they serve you at the spot (quick takeout). You then proceed to the cash counter to pay.

Great chicken spot!Getting your food can take a while. From the time we ordered to when we received the food, it probably took 20 mins.We got the 1/2 chicken with rice + salad, 1/2 chicken with fries + salad, and egg tarts.The chicken combo was really big, we probably only needed one portion for the two of us. The rice is really delicious! I was surprised to encounter such tastes rice here, which only made us sad we got the fries. The salad is pretty small, just a nice side when you need a break from the carbs. The chicken itself was really delicious and tender! However, it's really salty in my opinion. Also, I feel like Costco's rotisserie chicken might be more worthwhile...The Portuguese egg tarts were quite nice. They are probably sort of overpriced compared to other places, but delicious nonetheless. However, I will say I'm more of a Chinese egg tart fan.

Unlike most of the reviews, I didn't come here for the infamous Portugese peri-peri chicken...  it was the familiar aromatic smell of a certain Portuguese dessert which enticed me in.Despite being a fast-food style restaurant/take-away which (judging by the rush) looks very popular, Romados also has a separate section and counter for their baked goods, particularly specialising in Pastel de natas. For those of you who have not had the pleasure, these tarts consist of a sweet creamy custard nestled within a crispy flaky pastry shell - heavenly!  I couldn't leave without grabbing at least a dozen! The girls serving at the counter are very courteous - I asked to pick out my natas as I like them more browned/burnt on the top and she kindly agreed. Prices are super reasonable, packaging is good but most important of all, they taste oh so ooey gooey ahhh-maaazing!

Hands down the Best Portuguese chicken I have ever tried. If you eat chicken, try this place, this is a Must. Delicious juicy chicken, fries and salad served with a hot or a mild sauce. The setting is not fancy, but it's cheap, delicious and generous.I tied this classic Portuguese Rotisserie when we went to Montreal last year. There was a long line up, it took me more than 1 hr to get to the ordering counter. There are 2 lines, one for walk in and second for order pickup. Yes you can order in advance and skip the long line. I got it packed and also got few egg tarts. Went back to our hotel and ate it after 2 hrs. I was blown away, the chicken was so flavourful and juicy. Even the egg tarts were good. I will definitely go back there. Sometimes I get dreams about this chicken, and believe me I will someday just go for a drive from Toronto to Montreal and back just for this chicken.

I was very excited to try Romados.   I had read that it was one of the best Piri Piri chicken places in Montreal, so we headed that way.I ordered a half a chicken with spicy sauce and rice.   The chicken was ok, not as flavorful as I expected.  It was moist and tender, but lacking a bit of flavor.  The rice was gooey and wet, not my favorite.My BF got the chicken sandwich with fries.   The sandwich itself was ok also, the bread very doughy and the fries (they pile them up) were not crispy as I like them.   Others might love the place, for me, it was just OK.  Nothing to come back for anytime soon.

Had the half chicken for $15 including taxes. I used to love this place but the food was actually horrible this time. The chicken was extremely salty and the salad was soaked in a sauce. Sad to see the place going downhill, but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

While visiting friends in Montreal, they insisted we order chicken sandwiches from Romados. I had no expectations but I knew I was in for something special as the staff chopped meat for the sandwich from individual chicken legs. The spicy oil is a must try if you can handle a little bit of heat.All in, a very affordable and frankly unforgettable chicken sandwich.

Came here just for the Portuguese egg tarts and it was so amazing! $2 for one is not bad and trust me, if I did not have dinner plans after, I would've ordered dozens. It was cold when it was served to us, which I did not mind at all. It reminded me of Creme brûlée a lot and the flavor was addicting. There are two separate lines here - one for the savory food and one for pastries. Parking was extremely easy to find.

Came here on a weekend trip to Montreal, heard this is a great low key place for a huge portioned meal.They were correct!Got the chicken special, was satisfied and full.Pros:- cheap- portions- no nonsense- quickCons - seating area is small and hard to get to when it's busyWill come back again when I am in town!

We ended up here solely from some yelp research and it did not disappoint. The location is pretty easy to find (given we took an Uber) and it's a casual setting inside. We ordered a half chicken combo with 2 Portuguese tarts. Our total was $15. Great price for 2 people sharing the meal. Our order came with a half chicken (choice of mild or spicy sauce), salad, rice and fries. The chicken tasted fresh and flavourful right off the grill. It was plentiful. The salad was nothing special- regular shmegular salad. The fries were DELICIOUS and they are very generous with the serving. I liked the rice but I wish they gave a bigger serving. Maybe cut down the salad size and add a bigger serving of rice. If you're looking for cheap eats and good quality Portuguese food, look no further !

this place went down from my last visit a few years ago.thechkn poutine used to be filled w.hot fresh fries, a mountain of cheese curds and lots of gravy & chkn!! when i came by here over the weekend, fries were cold. cheese curds sprinkled sparsely, gravy was room temperatured (borderline cold), extra gravy was $2.50? $3? which is fine except they gave you a tiny like 3 oz cup?? highly disappointed especially for years (and the 5 hour drive up) i always recommended this place..time to find a new poutine spot in montreal.

Best.rotisserie.chicken.ever.Rotisserie chicken is not something I would ever crave out of the blues, and Romados is nowhere close to what I would call one of my favorite meals.. BUT! Romados really has given me the best rotisserie chicken I've ever had in my life. Chicken is juicy and bursting with flavor from the skin to the meat. The smokiness to the chicken tasted like a hybrid of a backyard BBQ + in-house rotisserie chicken. My order came with fries I didn't care much for, but nothing to complain about here since everyone comes for the chicken anyway.

The food is ok.  The service is horrible! They screw up my orders 2/3 of the time. When you call in to tell them, they fight you. They deny they made a mistake. It's completely insane. Insanity!!!! Sometimes they give you the desert, sometimes they don't. Sometimes they give you a bun, sometimes they don't. They make it up as they go along. Oh, and they can't read. Don't bother putting a note. They won't read it, or can't. It's incredible. I almost systematically get a 7$ rebate from foodora as a result. I appreciate the rebate, but I'd prefer it if these people would get it right. Is that too much to ask for Romados owner?

Romados is a great Portuguese chicken restaurant. It's tasty and affordable and am easy place for me to fill up my college-aged boys who consume massive quantities of food. The only downside from my perspective is eating in - I don't really care for the ambiance but the smell is amazing. What has worked extremely well for me is to order a large quantity of chicken for take out and then eat it at home while preparing my own sides. I even did this at my Airbnb and had the whole family over for a "thanksgiving" - way easier than dealing with turkey prep. The other thing about takeout is that you can call in and order it which is a lot more convenient than waiting in their long lines. Heck, the long lines are a good sign but I don't love to wait.

Visiting Montreal for the 1st time and their Portuguese  chicken did not disappoint.  Everything was amazing. We arrived 20 minutes before closing and one of the associates in Portuguese mentioned no need to rush take your time.  When I visit Montreal I will be back. .

So good! Romados has perfected their chicken, and even though you don't see the chicken in this picture, it's hiding under all those fries! You get a good portion of fries and salad and rice too, and couldn't even finish all the fries. We got two half combos, and three of us couldn't even finish it! So much food. Also definitely try their egg tarts! I was hoping the egg tarts would be warm, but they're cold. A sweet dessert, and while they look like Portuguese egg tarts I've had before, didn't quite taste the same. Still yum though.

This place literally saved my Sunday night. Heard a lot about the Portuguese chicken and figured this was the place to go to. Came in at about 8:15, which was close to closing and wasn't busy at all. Got a whole chicken (don't remember the exact number of pieces but it was in the low double digits). The chicken was juicy, succulent, and was just flat out great. I did get there hot sauce on it, which was more of a oil based sauce to me and it accompanies the chicken well. For my sides, they had ran out of rice which greatly disappointed me, but I found a complete and greater love in the fries. The fries have like a crack seasoning on it and upon eating them, they are flat out some of the best fries in life and will put you in heaven. I also had their salad, which is your basic tossed salad to me. However what sets it off, is their mustard-vingerette dressing, which sets it off and takes it to another level of greatness. Overall this was probably the best place I had overall in Montreal. Nothing weak on the menu, the place is small (seats about 20-30), love their Portuguese pops as well and great service. Must come to in Montreal.
If you go to Romados besides the amazing chicken you must try the Bifana poutine ! It is DELICIOUS

Super juicy take-out Portuguese chicken. I stopped by on a Friday evening thanks to a sudden craving, and it hit the spot. There was a ~10 minute lineup when I arrived at 8PM. Very affordable prices for what you get - I got a 1/2 chicken with two sides for $12 (you can choose between salad, rice, and fries). Decent portions. The chicken is amazing - comparable to Ma Poule Mouillée and a LOT closer to St Laurent lol. Also got 2 natas (less than $2 each)!Other comments: Pass on the fries (they're a bit bland). The 'spicy' is not that spicy, just a little flavour kick. Getting the sauce for a little extra would help. They don't accept Amex (unfortunately). And enjoy!

Long overdue review. I used to go to Romados almost on a twice weekly basis as a university student, resorting to means such as pushing a Car2Go in snowstorms to travel halfway across town for my chicken fix or going for protein-rich "healthy" fill-up after hitting the gym, ha!Romados is iconic for cheap & fast charcoal-grilled Portuguese chicken served with an absurd amount of fries, all brushed with oily spicy piri-piri sauce. Don't forget the Sumol or a soft drink or 1L of water to wash that down cuz gosh I'm always devouring the thing so fast that it's hard on the tubes.My only complaint about Romados is consistency of the food. From one day to the next, the chicken ranges from texture-perfect to overly-dry to stayed-in-the-warming-tray for too long. From perfectly seasoned fries to major salt attack. That's why when the fire happened and Ma Poule Mouillée opened, I became a regular of the new kids on the block instead. Now that Ma Poule Mouillée also caught on fire, guess where I'm back at.Although there are many better/more consistent joints nearby, Romados remains for me the OG of this city's overstuffed Portuguese chicken meals.Tips:- The half-chicken set meal is really big (appropriate for 2 ppl)- Get some Pastel de nata, the custard tarts- Did I mention salt attack? Don't tell my doctor, please- Places takes debit/credit, no AMEX- Call ahead to skip the line- Seating is limited, please share

This is literally the staple of Portuguese rotisserie chicken. About 15 years ago, I was attracted by the smell of this rotisserie while wandering around the area, and was hooked ever since. This is my first time back after the rebuilt from the building fire. The bakery side is smaller than what I have expected from the past.However, the grilled chicken is exactly as I have remembered: moist chicken with just enough char smothered with a splash of spicy piri piri sauce. There is constantly a line up in this joint and I am not surprised. If you are in town and want some casual eat, here is an excellent choice!

People of Montreal seem to love their rotisserie chicken so of course I made a stop at the most famous place to see what the fuss was all about. While certainly not photogenic at all, I know now why people are so crazy for this place. Quite possibly the best rotisserie chicken I have ever had! Incredibly moist and seasoned perfectly with crispy skin, what more can you ask for from chicken?! So good that I went twice in my short trip as well.You can cancel getting the portugese tarts. They are NOTHING like the ones in lisbon, so don't get excited.

This was another spot my friend and I tried during our weekend trip to Montreal. We were in the mood for Portuguese food so we looked on yelp for restaurants and this place came up. It had good reviews so we decided to check it out. When we got to the place we could see a bunch of  chicken being cooked in the back. It looked amazing. My friend and I shared the half chicken meal. The portion was huge and definitely enough to share. The meal came with rice, fries and salad. The fries were fresh and crispy. The rice was very flavourful. The chicken was cooked perfectly. We loved everything about the meal. We also got the egg tarts for dessert which were again very good.You have to order your food first at the front and pay. There was very limited seating available to sit there and eat. My friend and I ate our food there but found it a little tight. Would recommend getting take out. This is not really a sit and dine kinda restaurant.If your in Montreal definitely check out this place!

I came across this place as a must try in Montreal and I ABSOLUTELY AGREE.LOCATION & DECOR: 4/5A bit off of St Laurent Blvd, on Rue Rachel, this place is a bit hidden off from tourists. There is a cafeteria style lineup to order and pay, and an area to sit and eat as well. They also have a variety of portugese baked goods to try and sauces to purchase. FOOD: 5/5YAAS. I wish we had this place back at home because this is such a gem! Firstly their portions are MASSIVE. ~$9 for a 1/2 chicken combo already sounds great but it's actually an INSANE amount of food and variety! They fill the box right to the top! 1/2 a chicken is already so much but they top it off with a huge scoop of fries on top, as well as the salad and rice on the side. This is probably enough to feed two people.But not only are the portions big but every bite is DELICIOUS. I'm not a fan of rotisserie chicken but this place is amazing. Their piri piri sauce is SO good I dipped the fries in it. The people in front of me ordered a weeks amount of food at once, and I totally get why.SERVICE: 5/5The line for food moves a bit slower than I expected but they are very nice about it! They also have a ton of Uber eats/foodora orders coming in that they have to fulfill too. The staff were all very helpful and nice.This place is a gem I 100% recommend it!

Small, local shop known for their chicken. We came into the shop around 9pm. There was still a line and the place was super stuffy. It was already hot outside, but the heat from the grills made the store even warmer.Came here to pick up a 1/2 chicken combo plate. It comes with their famous Portuguese chicken, salad and a ton of fries on top. I really mean a ton of fries. For ~15 CAD it's a ton of food.  The chicken was really good and tender. It had tons of flavor and the sauce/juice makes for a great dipping sauce for the fries.Overall a cool place to go to get chicken. Side note, it's cash or debit only!

its been awhile i didnt come to this place its been like 1year and went today  its not that buzy its a Goood Portueges Chicken best in the  neightbor ...  get the 1/2 chicken with rice,salad,fries.bread ur 10$ its worth the price

Dropped by this past weekend after a many years. We ordered the half chicken with 2 sides. We had fries and salad. The salad was quite good and the fries was really tasty with the spicy sauce. The chicken was very moist and was as good as it was the last time I went. We also ordered the some Portuguese tarts for home and they were delicious. Would definitely go back again.

The Portuguese chicken here is the best. It's tender, falls off the bone, spiced to perfection and just plain delicious. This is definitely a greasy meal though so be prepared to use lots of napkins! When I came here, the cooks were extremely nice and packed the boxes til they were overflowing! The fries were thick and juicy and even the little side salad was good. You will definitely be full if you come here. The seating space is pretty limited so it's probably a better takeout spot more than anything. It also tends to get quite busy so there might be a little wait time.

Portuguese chicken!! BEST. AMAZING. OUT IF THIS WORLD. SUCCULENT. And on and on and on. This place came up when I did a general search on things to do, see and eat in Montreal before leaving. Bookmarked. Also came up, while on the Mile End Food Tour. This was my first soirée with Portuguese chicken, so I had no idea what was entailed. The place doesn't have much seating, but that didn't seem to deter the long line of faithful locals. Got here around 7:30, and they had a few massive orders before us in line, so it took about 30-35 minutes from front door to table. No, there's no waitress. Seating is free-for-all. We saw how monstrous the servings were, so we went with one 1/4 dark meat chicken meal and a quarter piece extra. The meal combo has a massive heaping pile of fresh made French fries that were seasoned so perfectly, I had to remind myself to slow down and really savor the flavors. And the Portuguese seasoned chicken? Yeah, it was unbelievable!! It's roasted over flames on a caged spitfire rotation. And this is the whole dang thing roasted. None of the proportioned crap. The whole enchilada. They slide the puppies off, then BAM BAM BAM! The chicken is chopped into pieces right in front of the patrons using super sharp knifes. They do it in about 4-5 loud bangs. They bast on there special liquid seasoned rub, and end of story. Done. Chicken portions are put in styrofoam to-go container based on what you ordered (no plates and metal silverware). Chicken put in first. Then a hujass clump of fresh hot fries cover the gobble-gobble, along with the side salad and dressing in the small corner compartment. Container closed, and your handed your boxes to take to the register to pay. The whole chicken chopping process is pretty cool. And everything is made right in front of you, so no questionable practices. I absolutely, positively can't wait to go back. One of the top meals I've had in my life!

Honestly my all time favourite place but I have two MAJOR issues I hope the owner is made aware of! One maybe it's just me but my experience with their food in the day is way better than in the evening. I have been thoroughly disappointed my last few visits with the quality of the food! Rice was over cooked to mush and the chicken was so dry and over cooked it hurt to swallow! They're lucky their food is so damn tasty. Second! What's the point of calling in and preordering? Makes no difference as every time I end up waiting in the line anyways. And when ppl respect their two lines, by the time I get up to the front and tell them I pre ordered, they ask my name and I still have to end up confirming what I order on the phone for them to prepare it! So what's really the point? All in all I love you guys but it sucks being disappointed by your favourite place. You have a few things to work on. For me it's more than just good food! I need consistency and good customer service.

Came here mid October. It's probably off season for tourists right now so we're lucky to have no wait in line.  Decided to try the Portuguese chicken from here since it had good reviews. We ordered 1/4 chicken combo. The chicken is juicy. The skin was the best. They give a lot of fries (nice & crispy). The food is good but it isn't the best we've had compared to New York food..Don't expect something fancy. This place is more like a fast food place. The meal comes in a takeout box.

We walked in at a great time because the line can definitely get long. You order at the counter and wait for your order. Then you proceed down to the cashier to pay. My family and I's go-to for takeout tends to be some sort of Portuguese BBQ so when we came across this restaurant during our stay in Montreal, of course we had to try it. The reviews didn't lie. The chicken was flavorful just as it should be. I have a red meat allergy so I couldn't try their pork but my cousins said it was all very good. We're used to being able to order a large tray of chicken with rice and fries/beans or a tray of pork with the same sides. This menu features more smaller combos for individuals. The woman behind the order counter was working hard! I didn't speak to her directly as my cousin order but she seemed like a pro and was dishing out orders fast for one person! I wish I got her name so I could shout her out but whoever you are, you're a rock star!

Romados has amazing Portuguese "crack" chicken as well as desserts all at an excellent price point. Cuisse 1/4 combo comes with a big piece of dark meat (leg/thigh) and a side salad and ton of fries.The restaurant has a divey vibe and is great for a quick dinner with friends or family or even takeaway because it is a lot of food for your money.I recommend Romados, especially the chicken with the spicy oil marinade.

Romado's chicken may be the best chicken I've had in my life. It was recommended to me by my Airbnb host. I love chicken but I thought to myself, "How different can it be from what I've already had?" I traveled across the city purely to try it out and I.was.not.disappointed! If I ever make it to Montréal again, Romado's is definitely on my list of places to go.

A Portuguese chicken staple that I love and frequented often back in the good 'ol days. I haven't been back to Romados since they had a fire but I like the upgrades they've done to their place since then. There's a couple spots to eat in now although it would be nice if they had expanded on that more.We came on a Wednesday after the lunch rush so there wasn't a lineup at all, a beautiful thing. The menu is small but there's actually more options than I thought. Honestly, I've only ever ordered the chicken combos.- 4x 1/2 chicken, fries and salad ($9.85) - the 1/2 chicken combo with comes with a mountain of fries, side salad and rice. They also throw in a white bun. Anyways, what to say about the Portuguese chicken? Delicious. ENSURE you get the spicy sauce because it makes all the difference in the world.- Natas ($13.00 for a dozen) - no trip is legit without an order (or dozen) of natas. It's $1.45/each but gets cheaper the more you buy. So light, flaky and creamy.It's hard to pick a favourite Portuguese place in town these days but I'll end with saying Romados is cheap, filling and satisfyingly good.
Very good charcoal bbq chicken. The chicken tastes like at no other place. Very affordable, nothing fancy, just a good  Portugese chicken place.
Got the half chicken for my daughter - she liked it. Rice was just ok. Side salad was alright

Got the half rotisserie chicken which came with a mountain of fries. The chicken was nicely seasoned and had a delightful bit of char on it from the grill. Fries were pretty average, but prepared fresh and hot so nothing to complain about there.There was a fairly long line to get my food but it was worth the wait!

The most renowned Portuguese restaurant for rotisserie chicken in Montreal. It is a staple in the area that you must try. I enjoy it and have it regularly but I'm not sure I would call it THE best but really really good. The taste, price and speed are a great option for lunch break. I'm a regular and happy with the food, it lasts days. Try it for sure. Enjoy.

**NOTE:  There is a pastry shop in the same building as the rotisserie chicken but the hours seem to pertain to the pastry shop FIRST since we got here at 10am on a Sunday expecting to grab some hot chicken but we had to wait until 11 for the actual restaurant portion opened up.  Yelp doesn't quite reflect this so if you want to be safe CALL! **If you like roasted rotisserie chicken then you can do no wrong by coming to this place.  Is this going to be the very chicken you've ever had....EVER?  No but for the value and the sheer quantity of chicken goodness then look no further.  I came here with 3 friends and after working out the hours of operation snafu, we were first to enjoy the chicken!  We wisely decided on getting TWO 1/2 orders of chicken instead of 3 1/4 orders and we think that it was a wise decision as the portions of sheer STUFF they give you can be ridiculous (see photos).  If you like a slight kick make sure to have them apply their hot sauce onto the chicken for maximum flavor.  Each combo came with breast and thigh meat, a side salad, rice and a BOATLOAD of fries.  Seriously, it's crazy.  The fries themselves aren't bad (should've asked if they had ketchup), the rice was well seasoned though nothing out of this world.  Salad was...salad with a vinaigrette type dressing and the chicken was quite tasty.  I personally prefer the thigh meat but my friend (who prefers white meat) liked it especially when soaked in that delicious spicy sauce.  The chefs there were super friendly and the overall vibe of the place was pleasant.  There are quite a few tables to sit at if you want to enjoy the piping hot chicken immediately so go for it!

The chicken is out of this world, everything we tasted had great flavor.The folks were helpful since my french is awful. The sweets in the bakery section were awesome too, even though I dont have much of a sweet tooth, I ate at least half a dozen of their pastries.

Third time here in 2 years and i must say each time is a pleasure for me.The staff is just amazing, funny and look happy to serve you up what is clearly going to be a mouth watering meal.I took the bifana for my friend and the half chicken for me each time I've had left overs for a lunch box the next morning you know what just as good the next day as it was the first.Wait time isnt very long and the price is just right go on down and get your hands on skme Romados you won't be disappointed.

Best chicken combo! I ordered the 1/4 chicken and you get a choice of salad, rice or fries and you can get any combination of these which is helpful. There is a sweet or spicy sauce that come with it but you can have it on the side. French bread is given too. The portion is big and the price is right! Chicken was flavorful enough for me so I didn't need the sauce. Highly recommend this place!

The food quality is very bad, oily, not well cooked... I throw out most of my food, could not really eat. Also the service was slow, they did not accept card so i had to go out to get cash. So much hassle for a low quality food. Never going back!
Romados ar Timeout Montreal sucks big time! They have displayed 1/2 and 1/4 portions of chicken with a 1$ difference, and they don't want to serve 1/4 portions. Fake advertising much?!

Romados has some of the best chicken I have ever eaten. When I think about Montreal I think about Romados. They're synonymous. It's that good. Combined with the fact that their sides are also the bomb, this is easily one of my favourite spots in the city.You're probably thinking a 1/4 chicken meal wouldn't suffice a hungry stomach, but Romados gives you a ridiculous amount of sides, and good ones to boot.Their chicken was incredibly juicy and the skin with a reasonable crispiness. The chicken was on the saltier side but that's where all the flavor is. You can also taste many spices and it's amazing. They give you their chicken 'gravy/spicy sauce/oil' which is heavenly when you dip just about anything in it. The fries, the rice, and the chicken, and the result is a flavor explosion.The fries were full of garlicky and herby goodness although they weren't the same as the last time I had them which were the clean hand-cut fries. Regardless, they were crispy and delicious. The salad was a necessary component, and the rice was perfect. I really appreciate that they give you all these sides (including a bread roll). It just completes the meal experience.All this for around $10 tax included. How is this possible?!

We were starved by the time we got here. The smell permeates the cold, winter air at least a block away from the entrance. You walk in and you see pastries to the right and a nice selection of beverages on the left. Rarely, do I see Guarana being sold in a large bottle, so I was already knew I would love this place once I saw that. There was always a line, but it moved fast.I'm sad that I missed out on the rice. That would have been great with the chicken. I went w/ the quarter thigh combo. The chicken is so tender and the skin is thin and crispy. The flavor was great and solid throughout the whole piece. I only regret not getting a whole chicken lol. At the counter, they'll brush the chicken off w/ either spicy or hot. I opted for the former and it wasn't that spicy, but still good. Haha the salad I found funny because it literally gets overshadowed by the excess of fries on top.
Decent chicken and huge portions -poutine is also really good. Wait was a bit long and the server was a little rude though.

Not too bad for Portuguese roasted chicken although i remember it being much more tastier a few years back. Definitely add the poutine option on top of the fries if you get the come and get a egg tart as well.

Things seem to have changed since people moved away from Romados and started Ma Poule Mouillée.  Romados is now down, way down. Last time I went the chicken looked so burned that Ieft and never went back... too bad.

Since this place is a few blocks from where I'm staying, I decided to give it a try. When I went inside there was a long line. I feel like when there is a long line it shows that the food is good and people are willing to wait for it. I chose the chicken style meal. It came with fries and salad. The chicken was amazing! It was soft and the skin was crispy. It was also spicy which added extra flavor. I also tried the Portuguese egg tart. It was sweet and cold. I prefer egg tarts coming straight out.

We ordered the 1/2 poulet (chicken) and salade and a   single 1/2 poulet. The combo came with a roll and spicy french fries they're were plenty The meat is so tender and juicy it comes with the skin on bones. They cut it into small portions making it easy to eat. So good it smokiness and flavor is so good!The salad came with a honey mustard vinaigrette which had a couple slices of tomato and slivers of red onion.For dessert the double pastry case was full of delicious Canadian pastries. We bought 6 of a custard favorite because it was a better buy. If you like tiramisu they have that as well. We brought them back to our room and had them with sparkling wine.The restaurant is located on the corner and was not hard to find.We will come back to try more pastries!!!

There's some really good chicken places in Montreal, but Romados might be my new favorite. When we grabbed an Uber from the hotel, our driver said we're going to a good spot, so that's a plus. My original plan was to go to Coco Rico, but they're "only" 4 stars and Romados was 4.5*, so I figured I'd try a new place. So glad I did!There wasn't much of a line when we showed up, and I think we were lucky. Guy at the counter was friendly, letting us try the spicy sauce for the fries to make sure it wasn't too spicy for him. We ended up splitting a half chicken and a small poutine and it was plenty for us. Cash only, but both dishes came out to under $20 I believe.Seriously this chicken is amazing, and makes me wish we had better chicken shops like this in San Diego. I guess I have to head back to Montreal with haste!

I've had this chicken a couple of times now and it's good! Just not the best. I've tried the sandwich and the normal chicken with fries. I think they have great prices and combos. The service is amazing. The restaurant is nice and spacious. The chicken is very seasoned which is great except I'm not a huge fan of very seasoned chicken. In the sandwich, it tasted slightly vinegar-y which I didn't like that much and they don't add any tomatoes, mayo, lettuce. So it's truly only chicken. The fries are also doused in herbs which I like but only for a while before I get tired of them. I am a bit bias though because Serrano bbq has my heart.

Awesome chicken spot in Montreal.   They give you the option of spicy or regular.  The difference is not in how they prepare the chicken but rather or not they pour the spicy sauce on top.   To quote one of the cooks there, "it's all in the sauce."  If you want rice you have to get there early as they run out everyday.   If they don't have rice you have the option of more fries or salad.  Portions are generous. We ate at a table there;  its not the most comfortable as none of the chairs in the restaurant have backs.   I use the word restaurant loosely as it feels more like a deli.  You order over the high counter at the kitchen and you pay to your right at the register.   Service was friendly and welcoming.

The chicken, the chicken. I know everyone in Montreal is gaga over the Portuguese style chicken here which is flame broiled and shellacked in a savory basting sauce. It's then served with garnish portion of a salad and a mountain of pomme frites (French fries for you anglophones). For $8, it's a meal that can possibly serve two. While the chicken was great and one can't go wrong with too many fries, the real winner for me was the nata pastries they serve here. Flakey cups of puffed pastry filled with caramelized rich custard. Delish! I was even willing to forgive the guy at the counter who excused my nervous broken French with "Bro, I speak English" after one bite of these delights.

ATMOSPHERE: Its a small takeout restaurant with few spots to sit down inside. Its pretty clean and the menu is small but its because they excel in what they make.FOOD: Awesome. The chicken was super flavourful, juicy and just perfect. Fries were awesome (best I've had) and rice is delicious. Also the portions are ENORMOUS. I couldn't even finish my dish in one sitting. Everything was on point. I would definitely come back here again if I was in the area.PRICE: Super affordable. The prices range from 5-10$ and this place is definitely a bang-for-your-buck spot.SERVICE: Servers are super friendly and nice. They're welcoming and are happy to give you as much food as possible as efficiently as possible.

Easily one of the best cheaper lunches I've ever had! Since the bulk on Montreal restaurants are on the pricey side, we needed a few lunch options on the lower cost side to balance things out and this was one of the places I had bookmarked. And it did NOT disappoint. it's a short simple menu. it's literally chicken and fries, some poutiness and a few sandwiches. that's it! We split a half chicken with fries, rice and salad, a small poutine classic and this beef sandwich. Total bill was maybe $30. I can't explain how much food it was, will add pics to this review soon! the quality was insane., the chicken and fries were out of this world. The gravy in the poutine was just perfect and the beef sandwich was one of the best things I ate the whole weekend!

Wow. This place is amazing. I'm from LA and I've been traveling for a few days now. I saw this place recommended from some blog and Instagram. I just had to check it out because I love food and chicken is one of my favorite meats. I got a spicy 1/2 chicken combo. It was a lot of food that I had to take the rest back to the hotel. The price was also very good. The chicken was very juicy and tender with their own spices which they sell..I highly recommend this place for anyone who likes chicken.

My friends and I visited this place on a Sunday and there was not much line at 6PM. I heard usually there will be a line so I'd recommend coming here a bit earlier than dinner time. We tried the famous roasted chicken and its perfect seasoning really amazed us, but it is just a bit greasy. We also tried the pastries and it has custard-like fillings inside. The texture is quite good but a bit sweet for us. Generally I'd say we will still come again.
DELICIOUS. Chicken sandwich extra hot sauce get 2 get the half chicken and fries the custurd tart is so yum. Worth the wait so gooodddd best sandwich ever!!

Been meaning to return to this place. Actually, my first time doesn't really count because I was in a rush and got the sandwiches without the hot sauce. Big no-no. Anyways, happened to be strolling around the neighborhood and decided to give Romados a solid try.I arrived at a good time (hardly any line) and got my order in relatively quickly (a chicken leg combo with fries and salad, WITH hot sauce). After the grumpy guy behind the counter gave me my food, I paid, and vultured around for a table to eat. Luckily, I found a nice little window table and set up shop. Let's see what this place is all about.The chicken was nice and juicy, but sadly, the sauce wasn't to my liking. Seemed a little more on the grease side as opposed to the sauce side. It wasn't horrible, but not what I was hoping for. I tried, but I just didn't taste a whole lot of spice. The fries and salad were solid. Would I return here? I suppose if I was in the area, but it isn't a spot I'd go out of my way to visit.

Often imitated rarely (but many places are trying) duplicated. Romados is the benchmark for Portuguese chicken and fries in Montreal. It's been a while since I've eaten here and can't believe I haven't reviewed it but here we go. Came here with out of town friends on a Friday night to explain this joint is a staple in Montreal dining. We arrived at near 8PM and the line was almost out the door. I explained to my friends the wait was well worth it. 20 minutes later we were eating delicious tender succulent charcoal grilled chicken. The flavour is really out of this world. The mix of the spicy sauce and grilled flavour is 7th heaven. The fries are light and heaping in serving. Also provided was a small salad. My friends had to try the chicken poutine and it came as a massive serving with a heap of chopped chicken. Words that come to my mind about Romados: sublime, delicious, light, flavourful, spice, seasoned, fall off the bone tender, huge portions, tasty awesome and inexpensive! If you don't eat here you are missing out on one of Montreal's finest dining experiences!

The most delectable, moist(sorry - hate that world but it's truly the most on point description) chicken you will EVER have!Yes that is a sweeping statement and I have nothing to back that up besides my personal opinion. But take it as you wish. I came here with my boyfriend around 1PM on a Saturday to no wait. We had no prior knowledge of this place and both ordered a 1/2 chicken. He got rice as a side, me the fries. Neither of us got it with the spicy sauce so I can't speak to that. He finished all the chicken but had loads of rice left. I clearly overestimated myself and definitely should've gotten the 1/4 as I couldn't even make a dent in the meal. The fries alone will make you put on 400 lbs. Absolutelynote that the portions here are crazy massive.  The pricing was on point for what you get, seating is very limited, and be careful because along with moist chicken there's a lot of sauce leftover that can easily spill.

Romado's Portuguese Chicken is the best Rotisserie Chicken that I have tried. Not too pricey either! So good that we came again our last day of Montreal. The 1/2 chicken combo is enough for 2 people to share. Don't forget to add on the spicy sauce! We also got their portuguese eggtarts which was very different from the portuguese eggtarts I am familiar with at chinese bakeries. This one is more sweet and creamy. We bought half a dozen back home and ate it as dessert for the next 3 days. Pop it in the oven to reheat and YUM.Food wise, 5 star-no doubt.I knocked off 1 star because during our first visit, they did accept credit card. But during our second visit, when we tried to pay with credit card again, the person at the counter said they do not accept credit card. Cash or debit only. So, this just made things a bit confusing. Since it was our last day, we finished up the last of our Canadian dollars and ended up having to use a debit card. Piece of advice, bring cash to be on the safe side.

This place has a long history. How come it's my first time being here.We two shared a full chicken, with fries and salad, two soups and two drinks. Very reasonable price. The seating area is so small and people took some stood for their coats.So be here early or be prepared to eat without seat.We ordered more than we can handle. Great chicken, and the spicy sauce was essential. The soup was a creamy potato soup. Very bland and thin, nothing special. The fires was not crispy. I like the spices and coating in the fries. Next time I will have a whole chicken only, as a take out, only 13.5$.The dessert looked so delicious but I didn't get a chance to try them. An extra reason for me to come back.

Grateful this place exists and is so close to home. If you like Portuguese chicken, than you will love it here.The chicken is cooked rotating on coal stoves, and always comes out perfectly juicy on the inside, and crispy on the outside. Two half chickens, is more than enough for a family of 4, and includes fries, salad, rice (if you come early enough). Definitely get the spicy sauce, it's really not very spicy, just tasty! This is a must try spot if you're in the area.

Love the Portuguese chicken here. My husband and I each got half a chicken with spicy sauce and fries with poutine sauce drizzled on top. The chicken was very flavorful and juicy. The fries had a good texture, not too soggy and loved the poutine sauce. The sauce was not too heavy.The line is out the door here so expect a wait. Additionally, not a lot of seating room so get your food to go. There is a nice park a couple blocks down and we ate our meal there.There is also a bakery but they give you so much food, we did not get any dessert.
There is a reason that there is a line out the door every time I've been here- it's great!  Grilled chicken (spicy optional), salad and natas...a perfect meal.

The Portuguese chicken was delicious. I got the quarter dark and my wife got the quarter white. I should have gotten the half chicken. Great spice and flavor. The salad was well dressed and fresh. The price was a  bargain. Parking is difficult to find but worth the trip.

Went there back a few years ago pre-vegetarian. A classic spot for good food in MTL. The fries are delicious and definitely made the biggest impression on me because I still remember them a few years later! Perfect location in Mile End and a fun environment that feels like a ma and pa shop! If you like chicken, head on over!

Starting off I never had Portuguese food, so I can't say anything about the authenticity of it. But we wanted to try it and it didn't disappoint!  Waited in line for their chicken, ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. When ordering you tell them how much of the chicken you want and they put it in a to go box with a huge amount of fries and side of salad. We already had dinner before going in, eventhough we were stuffed we wanted to try the infamous chicken. It was so delicious that we finished it all. The chicken was so tender and smokey and flavorful! We also had the tarts that was good as well. It low key tasted like a marshmallow, and I couldn't stop eating it! A PLUS Everything was really cheap and affordable too for the amount of food they give you. If I do go back to Montreal I am going back to Romados!

I think its really thanks to leaving Montreal and coming back that I appreciate its Portuguese food so much.  Even if you pay double the price, you still can't find delicious grilled chicken or nata outside of Montreal!!  Well, except maybe in Portugal, duh.What do they put on the fries?!? Sooooo good the spice mixture!!!  Addictive!This is my favorite place in Montreal for take-out grilled Portuguese chicken.  I used to live in Montreal so I love to come back when I visit.  Cheap, delicious and made right in front of you.  Omg, can't resist that huge counter window full of pasteis de nata!!!  I want to buy and eat them all!!! But no sharing. ;-) lol, haha!There are tons of good Portuguese places in Montreal, especially on the Plateau.  I certainly wouldn't say the other places are bad, there are so many good ones.  I say, go try them all!  But maybe just start with this one.  Its my favorite.  Oh, and yes I agree 200% with the other Yelper.  After you eat here walk across the street to Cafe Replika and grab some coffee!

A Montreal staple, Romados serves up some damn good Portuguese chicken along with other bar b q specialties. The fries doused in herbs and spices give the meal a nice side piece. Romados doubles up as a bakery serving fresh baked breads and pastries for ya sweet tooth. Finish off the meal with a refreshing drink that you can't find at your local grocery store.Spacing is limited during busy hours but take out makes for a nice little picnic at the park down the street (Mont-royal and Parc Jeanne-Mance to the west and Parc Lafontaine to the east).
Amazing quarter leg with there special fries and a fresh salade. Sitting in restaurant next to window with the wonderful smell of fresh chicken cooking on charcoal grill.

I have had their Portuguese rotisserie chicken combo with fries and salad several times now and the taste has always been great. However their quality is inconsistent making it a hit or miss place.The last time I picked up food for dinner from there, the chicken was undercooked and the skin had a jelly-like texture, which has turned us off this place entirely. The same thing happened to my friend. I hope they work on maintaining their standards as I love their fries and sauce!!!

Romados, Montreal's legendary chicken spot. For so long, this place has attracted praise, excitement and, reverence from all roasted chicken lover. As a chicken aficionado myself, I went to this place many times. The pastries and bread are always delicious, I love the small fruit tarts, but everyone here comes from one main event, the chicken.I really love the way they plate their chicken here. They put fries until it covers, well everything. I always ask for spicy sauce on both my fries and my chicken, and I always say yes to the amazing Portuguese bun they distribute. It is one of the best bang for the $ in the city.However, sometimes the chicken is a tad on the drier side, so come during the rush hours. It's never that bad.

Underrated small neighborhood place. Stumbled upon this place when visiting Montreal and decided to get their chicken poutine since the line up at La Banquise was too long. Turns out to be the best poutine I have ever tried. Their chicken is so thoroughly seasoned it is crazy! Not to mention delicious gravy at just the right temperature...definitely coming back!

I love chicken so I had to try some Portuguese chicken at Romados. I've had Peruvian grilled chicken, Southern fried chicken, even Filipino chicken. Loved them all!Sadly I wasn't impressed. Although the combo portions are huge here, especially the fries, the flavor was nothing special and the leg quarter I received was slightly burnt. Still a good value for $9 (combo with fries and salad was enough for two people) but nothing I would have a craving to return for.Everyone was drinking what looked like berry soda with the word Antarctica on the green can. Never seen it before but I'm guessing it's a Portuguese thing.Cash or debit card only.
Everyone here is so nice! They let us try the spicy sauce with a couple of fries so we knew how hot it was. The chicken is moist, the buns are crispy, it's all just excellent stuff

Oh Romados, how much do I adore you so - let me count the ways:Location - Rue Rachel and Rue de Builion in the Plateau-de-Mont-Royal. Yeah, it's a 7 minute walk from the Station Mont-Royal on the Orange line, or the STM 55 (St. Laurent/St. Urbain) bus line.  You got your OPUS card, right?  Good.  Rue Rachel is also bike friendly, so Bixi over.  Service - self service counter.  Wait on the long line for your shot of chicken rotisserie goodness, we are all equals here (unless you call it in for take-away in advance, get ready for the icy stares from lesser men and women, or has the tragic distinction of being a vegetarian...in which case, I pity you).  After you are done, take your chicken-y goodness to the Parc De Mont-Royal, or sit down on the bench outside.  Francine (I think that's her name) would come out once in awhile to greet you and ask you how you are doing in French (I think she is the wife of Fernando, the owner).  Merci beaucoup madame, le poulet est superb (sorry, my middle school French from NYC never really developed beyond this point). It's good to have the wife of the great patriarch of Montreal chicken ask how you are enjoying yourself in their presence.Food - yeah, as if you need to read my reviews to know that they are good.  Look at the satisfaction ratings - it's 90% above 4 stars as of Fall 2014.  But just in case you don't pay attention, here are the facts:a) Chicken - juicy tender and flavorful with that smoky flavor, the peri-peri based spicy sauce is downright addictiveb) Fries - plentiful, crisp yet soft and savory, salty like the way it should bec) Poutine - see fries.  Now add a healthy (to the cuisine, not to your heart) amount of cheese curds, properly set up so it's not cold, and then add some very warm and spicy chicken gravy on it.  It's Poutine as it was meant to be at the good places - it's pure and well crafted.  No silliness like guacamole, no bell pepper sauce, no hot dogs, no smoked meats like the has-beens at Resto La Banquise.  Just good, crispy soft greasy salty spicy dirty mess.  Like embarrassing good sex that leaves you itchy and sweaty all over.  Yes.  It's that good.d) Sumol - I know it's not an exclusive of theirs, but shots of Sumol should be poured while enjoying their chicken.  It's citrusy, it's effervescent, it's cheap(ish), won't give you a weird buzz like Guarana, and it's not coyingly sweet like those godawful American sodas.  Just do it.e) Pasteis de nata - the quintessential Portuguese custard/egg tarts.  There's a reason why they are ALWAYS sold out by 7p.  It's soft, it's crispy, it's savory, it's better than 90% of the tart practitioners in North America (and I should know - I hit the joints in Newark often).  Just buy some, and then try the other places in Montreal (a certain stall in Marche Jean-Talon comes close, just like some of the Chinatown bakeries on Rue De La Gauchetiere, but it's just not quite the same).  You'll see WHY it's better.  Value - $9.50 for a half-chicken meal, served with fries and tasty fresh salad.  Piri piri sauce optional (but highly recommended), or just fine by itself.  I dunno, the last time I ate at a Yelp 4+ stars rated place in MTL I had to fish out at least a Borden (AKA the Canadan Benjamin).  Here I whip out three Macs and got me some loonies and a toonie, that's good for me and the lady, plus we got leftovers good for breakfast the next day.  How about that.  If that's not value for the Canadian dollar, I don't know what is.  So yeah.  If you are in Montreal and just so happens to be in the Plateau, GO.  Pick up a Turkish coffee from Cafe Replika nearby, savor the evening, admire the street murals and await your turn with chicken goodness.

This is it folks.  You won't find better Portuguese chicken than this in Montreal.  In fact you'll probably have to go all the way to Portugal for better chicken.  Romados is an institution here and it has rightfully earned its legendary status.It's a fast serve place so you order at the counter and once you get your food head over to the cash to pay.  You can call ahead to order so you can skip the lines which is wise since this place can get long line-ups.  They are prepared for the crowds though so things move along quickly.  There isn't much seating so if the weather is nice you can always take your food over to nearby Parc Lafontaine for a picnic.Now let's talk about the main attraction: the chicken.  Romados claim to fame is their Portuguese-style rotisserie chicken and it is so delicious.  The chicken is tender and juicy and the skin is nice and crispy.  I like to get it with the spicy sauce because it adds a little hint of zing without being too intense.  The fries are also excellent being thick-cut (my preferred style of French fry) and seasoned to perfection with herbs and spices.  They are wildly addictive and you won't be able to leave any behind even if you're full.  Also let's face it, leaving behind Romados' chicken and fries would be downright shameful.In case the promise of Montreal's best Portuguese chicken isn't enough to entice you it gets even better.  In addition to being wildly delicious the food is dirt cheap.  A 1/4 chicken thigh with a MASSIVE side of fries and salad will only set you back about $8.  My meal in total came to $10.50 and that was because I got a drink with it.So now that you have plenty of reasons to go what are you waiting for?  Get down to Romados now!

Wow, the reviews did not disappoint! The chicken here is charred perfectly while being tender, and adding the spicy oil on top takes it to another level. Goes perfectly with rice! Good value for the price...will definitely be back!

This was my first experience with Portuguese char-grilled chicken.  I didn't really have any preconceptions; the closest comparison I have is Peruvian chicken a la brassa.  Major differences? The Portuguese chicken tastes like there is wine in the marinade, and the skin is not nearly as crispy.  It also comes drenched in a pretty bland piri piri chili oil rather than being served with flavorful dipping sauces.  The chicken was also a little flabbier than expected, as though the fat needed to render more.Overall, I liked but didn't love this style.  We sprang for a papo seco (fluffy, crusty Portuguese roll), which was a good call dipped in the chicken drippings. I also enjoyed trying a passion fruit soda -- not something you find every day.  Maybe one day I'll have the chance to try a competitor's chicken to see who best represents.

About a 2-2.5: Romados is a Portuguese bakery and grilled chicken place that is considered to offer one of the best grilled chicken in the city of Montreal.  The menu offers different parts of the chicken as family packs or as combos, coming with a bed of rice, fries, a side of salad, as well as a large bread.  You can opt for the chicken to be 'spicy' or 'regular,' which is a brushing of a sauce.  The hubs and I shared a 1/4 white-meat chicken combo, which came with a breast and thigh.  I was slightly disappointed, as the chicken itself didn't look like how many had described it to be, with the skin being nice and crisp.  It was definitely juicy, but it was lacking in the flavors, as even the 'sauce' didn't help much.  I'm sure you could request for some extra sauce on the side or some extra brushing, but I wasn't much of a fan of the sauce any way.  The bread, I didn't care for, as it was pretty dry.  Service was super friendly, and there's limited seats within.  Just note that there are 2 lines - one for walk-ins (on the left), and one for call-aheads (on the right). +friendly staff+complimentary bread with meal+juicy chicken, but still flavorless (?)

i'm from newark, new jersey, usa  i'm very very sure this restaurant, one of the world best portuguese  and the price is wonderful  low.eat everything  there[all]how i know, by looking pictures and video.everything  is so fresh yummy in your stomach!!!. in newark,  new jersey  population  300,000 people there.i know food too well. by the way,  byob and beers there? if no license  bring it if have licenses dont bringenjoy enjoy enjoygood life
Great lunch spot , the chicken had a lot of flavor and I added spicy sauce . The rice was mediocre, fries crispy and not greasy at all . They also sell pasties for a nice dessert !

Yes the chicken is good...great even. But what they excel in food, they more than lack in service. As I mustered up the courage to order in French, the guy behind the counter asked for our order in English. Great, I thought. But he kept questioning our order in a dismissive, impatient tone (1/2 chicken + 2-person salad), and ultimately gave us a whole chicken - a mistake I didn't realize till the cashier rang up over $20. We accepted the mistake, chalked it up to bad communication on our part. But then were told cash/Canadian debit only. "Well, we COULD take credit card if you don't have enough cash," she said, while watching me fumble for cash. Why the rule of cash/debit if you're wiling to concede? More importantly, why no sign of "cash/debit only" anywhere? (I looked - none in English or French) Meanwhile, the cashier turned to her colleague, rolled her eyes, and chuckled her look-at-these-dumb-tourists chuckle. How un-Canadian! ... I can say this because I'm Canadian, and we'd experienced great service everywhere else in Montreal as tourists.I came up 65 cents short in cash, apologized, and thought she'd simply let it go given the total amount. But she stared at me, shrugged, and repeated "cash or debit card only." No mention of credit card this time. We gave up a drink to reduce the bill, and bought the whole chicken - the leftover of which still tasted good the next day, but not enough to rid of the sour taste left in our mouths.

No doubt the best Portuguese chicken in Montreal. The chicken is grilled to perfection. The meat is moist and tender, not to mention juicy. Served on heap of golden crispy  fries. I can go on and on about how good the chicken is, but there are almost 150 plus reviews about it. Another thing no one here mentioned are the chouriço's. They are really good. Spicy sausage Portuguese style.  Lines are REALLY long, but they move fast. You place your order, pick it up and go to the cash register and pay by Cash or Debit. No credit cards accepted. Did I mention the food here is very cheap??? And yes, Their Nata's are good too.But you have to visit this place mainly for their chicken. P.S. : Definitely NOT a good place to visit if you are Chicken  Food -  Really GoodService - FastAmbiance -  What Ambiance???Worth the money - Sí

You can get more than portugese rotisserie chicken here: There is a bakery, patisserie, deli...My sister and i shared a 1/2 chicken  comboAnd got an extra helping of fries!Seasoning in general was heavy handed. We needed more than one drink.Some pieces were extra salty while other pieces were fine.The chicken was moist and flavourful with some charring.Spicy oil was poured on chicken. It gave the chicken a subtle spicy flavour that was like a slow burn, not very hot though.The Salad wass small and drenched with dressing.The food was made ready and Warmed up.The salt and pepper fries were naturally cut.

Stellar service and chicken sometimes the cashiers can rush but it's ok I get the hustle they are always busy and for good reason.Always get the chicken spicy, the salad is always delicious, and the fries are so well seasoned. I wish I could've gotten a sandwich either way no regrets and I'll be back !!Also pastries are delicious the egg tarts, coconut custard and almond desserts are all outstanding and the bread always delicious. Bottom line: amazing Portuguese chicken and pretty much everything else they make, charming service, and great prices!Just try it out for yourself.

Ramados serves hearty food for hungry souls, no doubt about that. My friends and I made this our first stop after driving 5 hours from Toronto. The fries and chicken went a lot way to fill our empty bellies and warm us up on a cold night.For three people, we ordered a Poutine with pork, a half-chicken with fries, and two soups of the day (veggie). Ramados' generous serving sizes meant this was more than enough for us.The chicken was flavorful, but a bit dry. The fries were very delicious. I actually disagree with other reviews that said the fries here are greasy - I detected no unusual amount of grease with mine. The Poutine is mediocre. Flavorful gravy, but no squeaky cheese curds, which signals a quality Poutine. The veggie soup had good flavor. It was quite thick and seemed to be made with a potato base.Seating was a nightmare, even around 8-9 pm. Order yours to go or be prepared to get aggressive. No Canadian kindness from me. Hangry Emily was prepared for battle.

Hands down one of the best chicken places! My sister and I can't stop thinking about it! The spicy chicken is juicy and flavorful, the salad (what the heck is in the dressing? It's magical!), the rice was sooo good, and the fries were perfect. It was a great flavorful, hearty meal for a great price. I am salivating as I type this right now. The only negative is the limited seating. You need to be a hawk and grab seats as soon as you can.

2nd time around, romados did not disappoint. I brought some friends with me and they enjoyed the chicken poutine. I however got the 1/2 chicken with fries and the chicken was well worth the 1.75mile bixi ride. The fries were fried accordingly and not gressy. My only issue was that no roll was given out like how it was on my last visit. I will be returning here in August when I come back to mtl

Very tasty chicken and fries especially if topped with the Perri Perri Portuguese sauce... You can eat there but too crowded and few places to sit. Only one bathroom and often not that clean. Still a good place to be. You'd better call first and order so you won't wait for a longtime in line to get to place one.

Worth the hype; Ramados offers authentic Portuguese style rotisserie chicken with addictive sauces and good service. The chicken is butterflied and chopped into finger food sized pieces. The skin is very crispy and beautifully seasoned. Order ahead to avoid lines. However,  we showed up to a lineup that stretched to the door and did not have to wait long as the staff bagged chicken after chicken with surprising speed. If you're hungry; get the whole chicken for two. Fries are also delicious from here. The salad is nothing to rave about but then again this place is not about eating salad. Staff is friendly and efficient.

My favorite Portuguese chicken place in the city. The service is great and they make your food really well and really quickly. The chicken sandwich is a must especially for only eight dollars with a mountain of fries. Always have to get the natas and whatever fresh pastries they have out for the day.

Really good food - some of the best chicken I've ever had!  It was seasoned really well, and very juicy, but might be a little greasy for some tastes.  The chicken dinners come with fries and a salad.  The salad was simple with a really nice mustardy dressing.  The seasoned fries were plentiful and had the potential to be amazing but they were a little lame.  I feel like they maybe they were prepared in advance.  Not a lot of seating, so you may be better off taking it to go.  Service was fast and friendly.  Romados was a good choice for a night out on the town.

The chicken is tasty but my review is mainly focused on the packaging received during delivery. We ordered a delivery directly from Romados; 4 chickens, fries and salad with extra sauce. They charged us for the additional sauce and for the delivery (which they notified us about ahead of time). We were shocked by what we received! It was a big deception!When opening the bag, there was sauce everywhere specially the extra sauce. Additionally, the bag in which the chicken came, got perforated and the chicken fell out of it. They fell everywhere. That's really unprofessional! Specially from a restaurant that has years of experience. They don't care about the packaging. When you are charged extra, your expectations are higher.

came here for the authentic Portuguese egg tarts, they are sooooooo gooood!!!!also got some of the pastries here, they are so so, but most of them are under $2, so i would not complain.the chorizo here is pretty good too.

This is yet another establishment which makes Montreal Montreal. Nothing fancy, no gimmicks, no attitude and amazing prices. Just roasted Portuguese chicken, fries, sauce, salad and a bread and Portuguese and French pastry counter.There is absolutely nothing more that I can add except to say that if you are visiting Montreal or a naive Montrealer who has never gone then GO. Like NOW.Chicken roasted to perfection, juicy and yet still practically falling off the bone. So good that you're going to use your hand to get right into the bone as well.And then the fries. These are perfect salt and pepper fries, which reminded me of the salt and pepper chips which the Kettle brand makes. Try to get them slathered with the spicy sauce and it's a joygasm in your mouth. They also sell homemade Portuguese sausages, buns and of course natas, their sweet egg custard cups which are probably the best in the city.For $13 bucks for a whole chicken, it's worth your while to pick up a bird or two, a large order of fries and take them home, keep them in glass containers to keep them fresh, and you have a great lunch meal to take to work for a couple of days.While you're waiting in line, it's an interesting place to people watch. Everybody seems to come here, I saw Portuguese aunties, guys from the hip hop crowd, snotty Westmount chicks waiting in the Land Rovers outside, professionals coming from work and everyone in between. That's the thing about great food; it brings everyone together.

Romados have redeemed themselves. My wife was at the church (Santa Cruz) a week ago and decided to give them another chance. The chicken, although small, was spot on and tasted like the usual excellent flavor - their fries were also delicious. That one bad experience last year with quality must have been a one-off.

user_city: At this point in time, I'm convinced that whoever is still eating at Romados is doing so because :1. They are too lazy to commute an extra 5 blocks.2. They prefer smaller and less tasty chicken.3. They like soggy, numbingly salty fries over the crispier, more conservatively seasoned kind.4. They are fine with an order of salad being nothing more than a decorative ribbon of lettuce embellished with heaps of token red onion and two meager half slices of tomato.5.They are friends, family, or sworn-in devotees.6. They enjoy lazy service offered in a broken Franglais.If you don't think that you can relate to the type of person described here, check out the #2 rated Portuguese chicken place on the island (hint: it's a few blocks away)

okay so, again guilty as charged for only finding out this place from The Layover, but I did do some research and was able to get a TeamBuy coupon for this place.The place is on the corner of a building. I think you just have to listen to your nose and also look for the line of ppl that are going inside. Sometimes there is also a line out the door!This place is pretty much the staple of every Montreal visit including Schwartz Deli. So what you order is the Roast Chicken with fries, extra extra hot sauce, egg tart for dessert & your soda of choice to wash it down. The  chicken is delicious, perfect, moist and all types of description for amazing Portuguese chicken! Dont get me started on the price, for what you get its a great frickin deal! I would probably eat here once a day if I could!LIke what Ryan T said, "Just writing this review makes my mouth water and brings back fond memories of my trip to Montreal." and this is soo true!Trust me on this, Romados is a MUST hit up spot when your in Montreal. Do not leave MTL without trying it!.

If you're visiting Montreal like the wife and I and trying to find this place, just walk down Rue Rachel and let that wonderful sweet smoke guide your senses.  That delicious smell wafting through the air will lead you to some tasty Portuguese comfort food. Plain and simply . . . Just order the chicken plate!  You can order it with a 1/4, 1/2 or full chicken. It comes with a crispy on the outside, tender on the inside rotisserie chicken slathered with a spicy, citrusy Portuguese barbecue sauce that'll make you say, "Thank Goodness we came here after that 2 hour hike through Parc du Mt Royal!"  A salad, rice and some of the best seasoned fries I've tasted is literally piled high on your plate.  I'm glad the wife and I shared a plate because I had just enough room for that Portuguese egg tart and coconut flan.  The egg tart was flaky, chewy and creamy all at the same time.  And if you like flan, just imagine flan with a little coconut rum like twist . . . Miam!Excellent food . . . Happy wallet!
Love the grilled chicken and the poutine simple. Small place with a few seating. Overall, we had a great experience and enjoy the food.

Dropped by here during a lunch a few weeks back.Let's be honest. The chicken in this place is probably the best you'll probably get in Montreal. It's tender, juicy and flavorful and comes with side orders that are equally impressive.I need to visit this place someday soon with friends and experience it all again.The price tag? Completely reasonable and in fact, another attraction to come eat at this fine establishment.The service is about as solid as it gets.If you have never eaten at Romados... why are you depriving yourself such an experience?

Went in not knowing what to order and ended up with one whole chicken, a large poutine and a plate of salad for a group of four. Service was excellent and will definitely pay a visit whenever I'm back to Montreal!

This was my first time trying Portuguese chicken, but I will without a doubt be looking for a place that serves it closer to home. We ordered a whole chicken with fries and salad to split with 4 people and it was enough for a very light dinner. Honestly could have a had 2 whole chickens because it was so good. Definitely get the spicy sauce!One warning for English speaking tourists- the menu is only written in French, but all of the people working were very friendly and helpful! There isn't too much seating inside, so I would recommend taking the food and eating elsewhere.

Portuguese Rotisserie Chicken from Ramados on Rue Rachel. I'll admit I don't know much about Portuguese food, but their thighs are LEGIT. Thighs and Fries, you can't go wrong.I still dream about the seasoning on their fries, and would drive the 7 hours north just for a nibble.

This is the best Portuguese restaurant in Montreal. It has a great atmosphere and I love the fact that the chickens are made fresh and so spicy. I ordered the fries and burger combo and my take out box was so full with their fries which is so delicious!! It's perfect. I'd recommend it to all as it's authentic and give you a great Portuguese fix! In addition, I also had their egg tart which is my fav. Loved it all. No bad reviews on them for sure. I'll be back :)

Met a friend for lunch and we thought of Romados. This place is packed at all times (I'm not a fan of eating at the restaurant cause it's not always the cleanest) We ordered the half chicken plate, asked if we could exchange the fries for more salad but they said no. 1. I don't think this place understands the concept of too much. I almost experienced 'death by fries'. I can't imagine someone would be able to eat that much fries. I literally had to dig for my chicken in the plate 2. I liked the chicken, it was however dipped in the chili oil. The portions were too big. I probably wouldn't go to this place again, cause I feel it's not worth the wait. However, price wise it is very reasonable. The salad is very basic, nothing special. Do not recommend this to others, unless you feel fries is life. P.S- some of us are trying really hard to be healthy, let us switch salad for fries! (Just saying )

Luckily we went there several times but no need to wait in a long line every time. The problem is if you'd like to eat there, there's no much seats. We two shared 1/2 chicken with fries and salads and finally got quite full. I like this Portuguese chicken, the sauce is good, although I think the texture is soft but not tender enough. The tarts is a little bit sweet for me, and I supposed it would be served freshly baked as bagels but not. Anyway, it's recommended! Chicken is good!

Yum yum yum! I am remembering the chicken and fries right now and I just want to salivate! We came here based on Anthony Bourdain's visit and I was determined to try. So tender, so flavorful! The chicken and fries were fully drenched with that "crack sauce." When I say crack sauce, I mean it is so addicting you don't want to stop eating. I don't recall the exact price of the meal but I shared with my boyfriend and it was more than enough food! There was a long line but it moved quickly and especially so when you know what you order. The seating is really small but you can easily take it to go at a nearby parks (seems to be parks are a plenty in Montreal). Luckily we found a table and chowed down! There isn't much space but you begin to forget about it once you eat. It is definitely chicken and fries to try and I can see myself coming here again!

Sometimes a long line but worth it.  Portuguese chicken is the way chickens prefer to be cooked.  I don't need all the fries, but it seems most people want all the fries.  No Debbie downer here.  Get this chicken!
All Portugese chicken places are born equal, but some are more equal than others. Get the chicken in any shape or form...if they made chicken smoothies, I am sure I would order them as well.
All the food was soaked in oil, could barely take a few bites. The rice was sticky, overcooked, salty and oily. The chicken comes with a tiny salad and a huge side of fries which were oily and chewy.
Really good, we took the 1/2 chicken combo the portions are generous and the staff if friendly. 100% recommended

Visiting from USA and saw all the highly rated yelp reviews. The chicken was very good and you get a ton of fries with your order. The seating inside was very limited and there was a bit of a wait on a Sunday during dinner time. You get a choice of sweet or spicy sauce on your chicken and a little bit of salad with it. Staff were super nice and speak English. We also tried 1 of the custard tarts for desseer and it was excellent.

This place serves Portuguese specialities and you can find everything there: bakery, grilled food, grocery shop, restaurant, etc. Why should you visit several businesses if you can find everything there?If you want to eat everyday dishes with a different taste, spend a good time there and order some roasted chicken with fries and salad (vinaigrette) and you won't regret.  Save some space for desserts! The meal would look like a traditional 'Poulet Rôti' but it will come with exotic flavors, not to mention that is roasted in charcoal BBQ.

I got the solo chicken sandwich. $8. The meat on my sandwich was literally only a single chicken drumstick. Nothing else. Inside a large bun that was dry and not so fresh. The chicken was very salty. The ambiance quite subpar. I asked for glass of water they gave me a tiny cup. I wish I had gone elsewhere. Did not live up to the hype. I was left hungry, with more thirsty  and very disappointed.

What can I say about this place other than it's the go to place for Portuguese chicken in Montreal.  It's been around for a while and locals and tourists alike love this place.  The service is pretty much cafeteria style and there is a seating area, but it's very small.  The line ups are fairly long and this place is busy until they close up in the evenings.  I suggest coming here grabbing take out and eating in the nearby park or on the hood of your car if you want to enjoy this chicken action.They give you a massive amount of food with each order.  You get your choice of chicken quarter or half, a ton of fries, a salad and a bun as well.  You can also choose to get hot sauce on the side or drizzled all over your chicken if you like.  I suggest on the side, as the chicken has plenty of flavour as it is.Overall a great spot to grab that Portuguese chicken you've been craving in the Montreal area.  The price is right and the chicken is juicy, what else can you ask for right?Oh yes and try their custard tarts too, so delicious!

Romados has started doing delivery service and it's not amazing.  I love their food (I wish I could love their sauce, but it has gluten in it) but Romados is really awful if it isn't fresh. My fries came cold with a lukewarm chicken carcass.  Dry and inedible.  Maybe you should stick to in-store or figure out your takeout containers!
This is the best Portuguese chicken in MONTREAL.This is the best Portuguese chicken in QUEBEC.This is the best Portuguese chicken in CANADA.Oh, the Portuguese tarts are rather awesome as well :)

For a chicken breast, salad and fry combo - priced at $10 - can't go wrong.  Can upgrade fries to poutine for extra $3.  Chicken could use A little more seasoning or smoke flavor., but Servers are great - gave me a sample of hot sauce before I ordered.  Huge selection of pastries.  Minimal seating.  Bring a big appetite.

I had no idea Montreal had such a thing for Portuguese chicken. Romados seems to be the most popular place to go for Portuguese chicken, it was recommended to me a dozen times. I had high hopes based on the extreme hype I received and I was mostly satisfied. I got the chicken sandwich and fries, my boyfriend got the 1/2 chicken and fries. I also got a Portuguese egg tart.
